content:
Insurance Quoting

To estimate how much a policy would cost, you use a quote. Create a quote by selecting products offered by the provider and using information supplied by the customer to calculate the estimate.

Three key aspects of quoting are addressed by corresponding Insurance components: product modeling, rating, and quoting processes.

Product Modeling
Supports defining the product or plan to offer, its characteristics, and the details that affect the rating calculation. Rules and taxes and fees are also set up on the product model.

Rating
A risk-based calculation of a premium based on a set of input characteristics. Ratings determine the cost a customer needs to pay in order for the insurance carrier to take on the risk of that customer.

Quoting Processes
Use services to find products and rate them. The basic flow follows:

The user enters information about who and what needs insurance coverage.
The system uses the getRatedProducts service to find, rate, and display applicable product(s) and prices.
The user chooses one or more insurance products.
The system creates the initial quote record.

You can build quoting processes for your users in two ways: Lightning web components and OmniScripts. Both use services to pull product and rating information into the quoting process.

Bringing It All Together
Check out Quote Business Process as an example of an auto quoting business process (from our Insurance Property and Casualty Application Suite) to see OmniScripts and the Quote LWC in action.

Next Steps
Want to see another quoting example? Check out Property Quote Business Process. Ready to try quoting for yourself? See Single Root Quoting, Multi-Root Quoting, and Large Group Quoting to learn more.

title: Insurance Quoting Solutions
